sentence.Network_en: And forty - eight percent believe in extrasensory perception, or ESP.
sentence.Network_cn: 23%的受访者称他们见过鬼,其中单身人士 、 天主教徒及从未参加过礼拜仪式的人“见到鬼”的几率最大.

auth_sentence.content: But he wasn't testing extrasensory powers; he was testing the decline effect.
auth_sentence.res_content: But he wasn't testing extrasensory powers; he was testing the decline effect.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But he wasn't testing extrasensory powers; he was testing the decline effect.

auth_sentence.content: But then, just as he began to believe in the possibility of extrasensory perception, the student lost his spooky talent.
auth_sentence.res_content: But then, just as he began to believe in the possibility of extrasensory perception, the student lost his spooky talent.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But then, just as he began to believe in the possibility of extrasensory perception, the student lost his spooky talent.

auth_sentence.content: The extrasensory powers of Schooler's subjects didn't decline they were simply an illusion that vanished over time.
